title: Print, "Elevation and Plan for a Public Fountain", 1745
medium: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper
inscribed:
On plate, upper center: C.P.S.C.M.; upper right: M.; lower left: F. de Cuvillies Inv.; lower right: A Paris chez Poilly ruë St. Iacque C.P.R.; lower right: 4

Note: The 2nd impression in a second state with a new number, upper left: 10, and the number lower right, removed.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 80 and 81)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Elevation and Plan for a Public Fountain", 1745.
1745. Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-285-66.
